meanings.definition: A sheet of paper folded once to form two leaves or four pages.
meanings.sent1: I found some old folios in the attic.
meanings.sent2: The book was made up of several folios bound together.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to play with the folios, creating a mess in the study.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like scattered folios, waiting to be organized into a coherent story.
meanings.sent5: The folios rustled as she turned the pages, filling the room with a soft sound.

meanings.definition: A sheet of paper, parchment, or similar material, especially one of a series, folded and sewn together.
meanings.sent1: He carefully examined the ancient folios in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The folios of the manuscript were beautifully illustrated.
meanings.sent3: The folios seemed to dance in the wind, as if eager to tell their story.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like fragile folios, easily torn and lost.
meanings.sent5: The folios held secrets of the past, waiting to be discovered by curious minds.
